data.name: WIC Jol-Lichthardt Expedition
data.desc: WIC send CC Jol and Jan Corneliszoon Lichthardt against Sp and Portuguese, after which Jol is joined by reinforcements, but their cruising is met with a hurricane off Havana, after which they retreat
data.locn: Texel, Pernambuco, Olinda, Ile a Vache, Havana, Cape San Antonio, Dry Tortugas, Matanzas, Florida Straits, Pernambuco
data.agents_nsp0: Cornelis Corneliszoon Jol, Jan Corneliszoon Lichthardt, Bartel Wouters 36 Sail
data.prim_n: WIC 1.05.01.01, 55 [9 May, 10 Jul, 6, 9 Oct 1640] / Staten 1.01.02, [missg] [Resolutions of 24 Dec 1639] / Wright D 2 pp *36-*46 / Barlaeus 196 = Barlaeus/Naber 257
data.note:
= CC Jol’s last visit to Caribbean /v Goslinga 252 /
 Fleet on leaving Olinda on 14 Jul 1640 = 24 Sail 2,000 sailors 1,700 soldiers ... is joined c. early Sep 1640 near Havana by 2 Yachts from Curaçao and 10 Privateers sent by Prince of Orange /v Goslinga 250 /
 Hurricane off Havana on 11 Sep 1640, for 3 days, 'the Dutch were terror-stricken' = loss of 7 t 8 ships ... later arrive in Pernambuco with 16 ships /v Goslinga 251-252
